lines.text: I went down to Concord to check it out. The president is Mel Gordon. The vice-president and treasurer is Gordon LaRiviere. Those boys are buying up the mountain, Wade. $364,000 this year. I believe that's out of LaRiviere's league.

lines.speaker: u140

lines.text: I screwed up the divorce. I agreed with everything she said. I wanted her to like me. I just want to be a good father.

lines.speaker: u154

lines.speaker: u141
lines.text: Good. It would help if there were some drug or alcohol abuse on the part of your ex-wife. Sexual problems upsetting to the child.

lines.speaker: u141
lines.text: Hard to say. If we go for custody, depositions, psychiatric evaluations, it could drag on. Ten or twelve thousand dollars. She could win on appeal. If we just want to get the visitation rights redrawn, assuming they're unduly restrictive, it wouldn't be more than twenty-five hundred.

lines.speaker: u154
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: u141

As for withdrawing your support from us, you are perfectly welcome to carry yourself whithersoever you please. lines.text: I have good news for you, Mr. Cosgrove.  The firm of Bracegirdle and Chatwick, in the city of London, are prepared to lend you 20,000 pounds, pledged against your interest in the Edric mines.  They will redeem the encumbrances against the property, which amount to some 10,000 pounds, and take a twenty- year working lease on the mines. They will lend you the 20,000 pounds against the lease income, which they will apply to the loan as it comes in, and they will make a charge of 18% per annum interest on the outstanding loan balance.

lines.speaker: u473
lines.text: Mr. Newcombe, I have made some difficult loans during the past few years, at very onerous terms, but 18% a year interest seems very stiff indeed.

lines.text: Considering your financial circumstances, Mr. Cosgrove, it has been impossible to find anyone at all prepared to do any business with you.  I think you may count yourself lucky to have this opportunity. But, obviously, if you would reject this offer, I shall keep trying to find a better one.

They were quite insistent on this point, and said they must have absolute assurance of her ladyship's perfect freewill in the transaction before they would advance a shilling of their capital.

lines.speaker: u469
lines.text: When I asked them in what form they would accept her ladyship's assurances, they said that they were only prepared to accept them if her ladyship confirms her written consent by word of mouth, in their presence, at their counting-house in Birchin Lane, London.  I requested they come here, and save her ladyship and yourself the inconvenience of the trip to London, but they declined, saying that they did not wish to incur the risk of a visit to Castle Hackton to negotiate, as they were aware of how other respectable parties, such as Messrs. Sharp and Salomon had been treated here.

lines.speaker: u889
lines.text: Tell me. When you grew up in Brooklyn, how many astronauts did you know?  You went your own way then. You didn't listen to people. So why start now...?

lines.speaker: u890
lines.text: No more cracks about how I look.

lines.speaker: u893
lines.text: Hey, I'm Mr. Sensitivity now.  Clear the way, wide load coming through.

lines.speaker: u892
lines.text: But... this disease... is progressive... degenerative...

lines.speaker: u899
lines.text: That's terrible news...

lines.speaker: u897
lines.text: What are you doing --

lines.speaker: u893
lines.text: Sis. Let me take care of you for once.

lines.speaker: u897
lines.text: But Johnny... you can't fly.

lines.speaker: u899
lines.text: Make sure you find Ben, bring him back here. And keep it quiet. I don't need this to hit the press.

lines.speaker: u894
lines.text: Yes sir. You've got the Mayor at eight, then a nine-thirty interview with the Journal --

lines.speaker: u899
lines.text: Front page?

lines.speaker: u894
lines.text: Top left, like you asked.  Today Wall Street. Tomorrow, who knows... maybe Washington.

lines.speaker: u895
lines.text: But I'm not done with the machine --

lines.speaker: u899
lines.text: Which is precisely the point. Analysis is over. It's time for action. My men could have mass-produced this by now.

lines.speaker: u897
lines.text: Please don't make this personal --

lines.speaker: u899
lines.text: Oh, I think you already have.

lines.speaker: u897
lines.text: Victor, we can't do anything until the research is ready.

lines.speaker: u898
lines.text: Reed's gonna fix me up --

lines.speaker: u899
lines.text: For your sake I hope you're right. I'm sorry if that sounds a little skeptical.

lines.speaker: u898
lines.text: Skeptical...?

lines.speaker: u900
lines.text: Brad, I really fuckin' hate McDonald's, man. Ever since they started in with the chicken, everything went downhill.

lines.speaker: u901
lines.text: You want to work at Carl's?

lines.speaker: u900
lines.text: Oh, man, if you could swing something there, I'd do anything for you. I want to work with you guys.

lines.speaker: u901
lines.text: I can probably get you in there. Just let me talk to Dennis Taylor.

lines.speaker: u900
lines.text: All right!!

lines.speaker: u905
lines.text: Did you threaten this man or use profanity in any way?

lines.speaker: u901
lines.text: He insulted me first. He called me a moron.

lines.speaker: u905
lines.text: Did you threaten this customer or use profanity in any way?

lines.speaker: u901
lines.text: Yes, sir.

lines.speaker: u905
lines.text: You're fired.

lines.speaker: u903
lines.text: Jeff you have company!

lines.speaker: u914
lines.text: Go away, Curtis. If you can't knock, I can't hear you.

lines.speaker: u916
lines.text: And... you can only tell it's the right girl if you're sensitive.

lines.speaker: u904
lines.text: Sensitive -- what is that?

lines.speaker: u916
lines.text: Sensitive is when you can tell how people feel without asking.

lines.speaker: u904
lines.text: So what makes you so sensitive?

lines.speaker: u916
lines.text: Well, for one, I read. I don't watch as much television as you. I'm trying to feel things more. I'm learning a lot about people.

lines.speaker: u904
lines.text: What do you read? What's the last book you read?

lines.speaker: u916
lines.text: Lust For Life. It's the story of Vincent Van Gough.

lines.speaker: u904
lines.text: Yeah, well, I saw the movie. That must mean I'm sensitive too.

lines.speaker: u916
lines.text: It's a way, Damone. It's a vibe. I put it out, and I have personally found that girls do respond.

lines.speaker: u910
lines.text: All right, what you want to do is go to the Free Clinic and tell the doctor that you have sex regularly -- several times a week -- and that you need Nornel One Plus Fifty's.

lines.speaker: u906
lines.text: And they don't call my parents?

lines.speaker: u910
lines.text: Not if you're over sixteen.

lines.speaker: u906
lines.text: Okay. Thanks a lot, Linda.

lines.speaker: u910
lines.text: And don't let them talk you into a diaphragm either.

lines.speaker: u907
lines.text: What's going through your mind right here, Jeff? The danger of it all?

lines.speaker: u914
lines.text: Merv, I'm thinking... I've only got about four good hours of surfing left before these little clowns from junior high start showing up with their boogie boards.

lines.speaker: u909
lines.text: That's him! He did it!

lines.speaker: u914
lines.text: Hey, mon, I don't know what your trip is, but...

lines.speaker: u915
lines.text: Where's Doug?

lines.speaker: u910
lines.text: He's not coming.

lines.speaker: u915
lines.text: Not coming? What happened?

lines.speaker: u910
lines.text: He says he's got to stay in Chicago.  He says I should visit him sometimes.

lines.speaker: u915
lines.text: Sometime?

lines.speaker: u910
lines.text: Yeah, like maybe never.

lines.speaker: u915
lines.text: But what are you going to do?

lines.speaker: u910
lines.text: Well I might go to Dartmouth.

lines.speaker: u915
lines.text: Dartmouth?!

lines.speaker: u910
lines.text: I didn't tell anyone I applied cause I never thought I'd make it.

lines.speaker: u915
lines.text: I can't believe it! But what about Doug?

lines.speaker: u910
lines.text: There's a world of guys out there. I just wish I didn't have to date any of them.

lines.speaker: u915
lines.text: Hey -- Doug Stallworth? It's his loss.

lines.speaker: u914
lines.text: Aloha, Mr. Hand!

lines.speaker: u912
lines.text: Aloha, Spicoli.

lines.speaker: u913
lines.text: Is this your first time?

lines.speaker: u915
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u916
lines.text: Well, I don't know, I may be doing some traveling this summer. I don't know how much I'll be around...  But I'll give you a call sometime.

lines.speaker: u915
lines.text: I'd like that.

lines.speaker: u917
lines.text: Are you sure there's nothing else I can bring you?

lines.speaker: u916
lines.text: I'll have one more Coke... Do you want another Coke, Stacy?

lines.speaker: u918
lines.text: The woman who left that message for you sounded very disturbed. I think she was crying...

lines.speaker: u920
lines.text: Crying? Why was she crying?

lines.speaker: u918
lines.text: Well, uh. She didn't say Mr. Duke. But since I know you're here with the Police Convention...

lines.speaker: u920
lines.text: Look, you want to be gentle with that woman if she ever calls again. We're watching her very carefully... this woman has been into laudanum. It's a controlled experiment, but I suspect we'll need your cooperation before this thing is over.

lines.speaker: u918
lines.text: Well, certainly... We're always happy to cooperate with the police...

lines.speaker: u920
lines.text: Don't worry. You're protected. Just treat this poor woman like you'd treat any other human being in trouble.

lines.speaker: u918
lines.text: What? Ah... yes, yes, I see what you mean... Yes... so, you'll be responsible then?

lines.speaker: u920
lines.text: Of course. And now I have to get back to the news. Send up some ice.

lines.speaker: u919
lines.text: Hell, I really hate to hear this. Because everything that happens in California seems to get down our way, sooner or later. Mostly Atlanta. But that was back when the goddamn bastards were peaceful. All we had to do was to keep 'em under surveillance. They didn't roam around much... But now Jesus, it seems nobody's safe.

lines.speaker: u921
lines.text: You're going to need to take the bull by the horns -- go to the mat with this scum.

lines.speaker: u919
lines.text: What do you mean by that?

lines.speaker: u921
lines.text: You know what I mean. We've done it before and we can damn well do it again!

lines.speaker: u922
lines.text: Okay. Here's how it is. What goes into my book, as of noon, is that I apprehended you... for driving too fast, and advised you to proceed no further than the next rest area... your stated destination, right? Where you plan to take a long nap. Do I make myself clear?

lines.speaker: u920
lines.text: How far is Baker? I was hoping to stop there for lunch.

lines.speaker: u922
lines.text: Not my jurisdiction. The city limits are two point two miles beyond the rest area. Can you make it that far?

lines.speaker: u920
lines.text: I'll try. I've been wanting to go to Baker for a long time. I've heard a lot about it.

lines.speaker: u921
lines.text: Oh, and don't bother to make up the room. That way we won't have to risk another of these little incidents, will we?

lines.speaker: u924
lines.text: Whatever you say, gentlemen. I can't tell you how sorry I am about what happened...

lines.speaker: u921
lines.text: Don't worry, it's all over now. Thank God for the decent people.

lines.speaker: u926
lines.text: Sorry, didn't mean to scare you.

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: Where is everyone?

lines.speaker: u926
lines.text: I don't know, I just got here. Did you find your girl?

lines.speaker: u937
lines.text: That's an unwise thing to say, you know that?

lines.speaker: u927
lines.text: Just an observation.

lines.speaker: u937
lines.text: Well, why don't you keep your observations to yourself?

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: It's imperative that you get that truck moving.

lines.speaker: u928
lines.text: Just cover me. It was built to move.

lines.speaker: u929
lines.text: What? Really?

lines.speaker: u930
lines.text: Uh huh, now wiggle that sweet little ass over here and sit on Daddy's face, I wanna do some appraising.

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: What's it for!?

lines.speaker: u930
lines.text: Grass. I grow some pot down there. It's no big deal, just something I dabble in. The truck's for a quick get away, deliveries, whatever.

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: Is it gassed up?

lines.speaker: u930
lines.text: Fully.

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: Four door?

lines.speaker: u930
lines.text: Two.

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: Open?

lines.speaker: u930
lines.text: Covered.

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: How many?

lines.speaker: u930
lines.text: Holds four.

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: Max?

lines.speaker: u930
lines.text: Seven.

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: Nine?

lines.speaker: u930
lines.text: Seven.

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: Keys.

lines.speaker: u930
lines.text: What!? So you can just get the hell outta here and forget about all of us!? No way! That's my god damn truck!

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: Let me make this clear; if we stay, we die!

lines.speaker: u930
lines.text: I don't trust you. No way! I pick who goes! And I'm holding you responsible.

lines.speaker: u931
lines.text: OH JESUS!

lines.speaker: u936
lines.text: HELLLPPP!

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: Let's move.

lines.speaker: u932
lines.text: I'm done drinking. That's it. Just Church and grocery stores. Nothin' else.

lines.speaker: u933
lines.text: Let's wait it out.

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: They'll tear this place down within the hour.

lines.speaker: u941
lines.text: Did we make it?

lines.speaker: u935
lines.text: I think --

lines.speaker: u940
lines.text: What have you done now, broke the darn thing?

lines.speaker: u938
lines.text: I just hit it like you said.

lines.speaker: u942
lines.text: Frances?  Oh no.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: Refill my drink, will you, Bob?

lines.speaker: u942
lines.text: What're you doing?

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: Putting on my armor.

lines.speaker: u942
lines.text: Come on, Frances. Louella Parsons is here. She wants to talk to you, help you out.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: Louella... didn't she call me a spoiled little bitch?

lines.speaker: u942
lines.text: Come on, she's an important columnist! What's the matter? I thought you wanted these people to forgive you.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: 'Forgive'...? For What?

lines.speaker: u942
lines.text: I'm sorry... that was an unfortunate choice of words.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: Look, Mr. Bebe, you can hold me to my contract, but you can't break me. I'm back, and I'm gonna make the best of it.

lines.speaker: u943
lines.text: I'd like nothing better.

lines.speaker: u944
lines.text: That's not all, Frances. Mr. Bebe is very concerned about your politics. He hears you've been donating money, speaking at rallies.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: Yup. Claire... please, please tell Mr. Bebe that if he worried half as much about his scripts as he does about my private life, we'd make a lot better movies.

lines.speaker: u944
lines.text: I'm sorry, Frances. It's my job, you know?

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: I know.  'This is a factory and we each have our jobs. The writer writes, the director directs, and the actress...'

lines.speaker: u944
lines.text: ...acts. I'll relay your message.

lines.speaker: u945
lines.text: Okay, but come here first.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: Huh.

lines.speaker: u945
lines.text: Come here. I want to show you something.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: You don't think I'm good enough?

lines.speaker: u946
lines.text: What?! Good Lord no, it's just... It's money. We needed backing and... well, we found it.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: u946
lines.text: An actress.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: A rich actress.

lines.speaker: u946
lines.text: Yes. That's the deal. She plays Lorna.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: But... but wait a minute. We're supposed to be different, right? Clifford says... This theatre is supposed to be different! And this play... this play is all about what greed and money do to people!

lines.speaker: u946
lines.text: I know, but --

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: What does Clifford say?

lines.speaker: u946
lines.text: Right now we have to be practical.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: Does Clifford even know?  You didn't tell him, did you?  I'm gonna tell him. Where is he?

lines.speaker: u946
lines.text: He knows, Frances.

lines.speaker: u947
lines.text: Get your clothes on.

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: You have no right! You have no fucking right, you bastards! Get the hell out of here --

lines.speaker: u947
lines.text: Get your clothes on, lady --

lines.speaker: u955
lines.text: GET OUT!

lines.speaker: u947
lines.text: You're under arrest.
